 *end* Also known by the title of MAN *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
PART TWO

The Rituals Themselves



SECOND DEGREE

Prefatory Note

This is the last of the O.T.O *end* degrees based on the symbolism of Saladin and the Oasis *end* Beyond the
second degree symbolism is apart from its Thelemic elements based on that of Freemasonry *end*
Second Degree

OPENING

The Oasis is open in the First Degree *end* The C *end* has been given the Pass Word *end* The tent etc *end* of S *end* have
been moved to the centre facing West *end* The water of the Well is reduced to a small depth *end* S *end* crosses his
hands right over left; W *end* and E *end* take them between theirs *end*
S *end* A *end*
W *end* U *end*
E *end* M *end*
All AUM *end*
S *end* Rises *end* Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law *end*
W *end* Rises *end* Love is the law *end*
E *end* Rises *end* Love under will *end*
S *end* Fellow-soldiers assist me *end* What is the first duty of a Magician *end*
W *end* Most Mysterious Master to guard the Camp *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* Let the camp be guarded *end*
Done *end*
W *end* Most Mysterious Master the Camp is duly guarded *end*
S *end* The next duty *end*
E *end* To see that all present are Magicians *end*
S *end* To order fellow-soldiers *end*
Pose and Sign *end*
S *end* How many officers has the Camp *end*
W *end* Three visible *end*
E *end* And eight invisible *end*
S *end* What have we found in the Well *end*
W *end* Truth *end*
S *end* What else is there *end*
E *end* Refreshment *end*
S *end* Let us partake thereof *end*
They go as before to the Well but S *end* leaves his candle *end* At the East of the Well they form a triangle *end* W *end*
and E *end* put their four hands on S.’s shoulders *end*
W *end* and E *end* We swear to guard you in your ways *end*
They turn as to guard him *end*
S *end* dips his hand in the Well and offers them to drink drinking also *end* Wine in a cup should be placed in
the well for this *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* Who drinketh of wine shall thirst again; but whoso drinketh of the wine that I shall give him shall
never thirst again *end*
They return *end*
S *end* Fellow-soldiers we have drawn the Wine of Life from the Well of the Oasis *end*
O.T.O *end* applause *end* All resume seats *end*
The place is open in the first degree *end*
FIRST POINT Consecration

S *end* Brother-soldiers .. *end* is now a candidate to be consecrated a Magician; we must first give proofs of his
worthiness to acquire virtue *end* I shall therefore put the necessary questions *end*
E *end* brings C *end* to face throne *end*
S *end* Where were you first prepared for your initiation *end*
C *end* In heart verily *end*
S *end* Where next *end*
C *end* In a convenient place hard by a spring *end*
S *end* How long did you remain there *end*
C *end* For nine moons *end*
S *end* Where were you initiated *end*
C *end* In an Oasis *end*
S *end* At what hour *end*
C *end* Dawn *end*
S *end* The Sun is risen *end* Do you pledge your honour as a Man and your fidelity as a Brother that you will
steadily persevere through the ceremony of being consecrated a Magician *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
C *end* I do *end*
S *end* I warn you that a severe test of your sincerity will be required *end* Unless you are prepared to jeopardize
your social position and possibly your liberty or your life it will be better for you to withdraw on the
instant *end* I wish further to impress firmly upon you that this Order is a serious body of men courageous
earnest and faithful and that these remarks are not the make-believe terrors of orders instituted for the
amusement of grown-up children *end*
Pause *end*
S *end* Loudly *end* Candidate do you persist in your Will to be consecrated a Magician *end*
C *end* I do *end*
S *end* Do you likewise pledge yourself under penalty of your obligation that you will conceal what I shall
now import to you with the same strict caution as our other secrets *end*
C *end* I do *end*
S *end* Then I will entrust you with the Pass Grip and Pass Word leading to the degree to which you seek
admission *end*
The Pass Grip is given by joining hands as you have been taught and twisting the wrist sharply to the
right *end* The Pass Word is Thelema which means WILL in the Greek language *end* Look frankly and fearlessly
into my eyes and say with me

The Word of the Law is THELEMA *end*
You will now retire from the Camp to a prepared place there to undergo the necessary preparations for
your consecration *end*
E *end* takes C *end* out *end*
SECOND POINT The Oath

The C *end* is prepared by baring the right arm to the shoulder the sleeve of his robe being securely pinned
back *end* The Camp is opened in the Second Degree *end* E *end* goes out prepares C *end* and knocks twice *end* W *end* opens
door *end*
W *end* Whom have you there *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
E *end* A Man and a Brother who wills to be consecrated a Magician *end*
W *end* Halt *end*
W *end* applies Disk to Breast of C *end*
S *end* Do you vouch that he is properly prepared *end*
W *end* I do *end*
S *end* Admit him in due form *end*
C *end* is led to throne by E *end*
S *end* Gives grip *end* What is this *end*
C *end* The Grip or Token of a Man and a Brother *end*
S *end* What does it demand *end*
C *end* A Word *end*
S *end* Give me that word *end*
C *end* At my initiation I was taught to be cautious; I will letter it with you *end*
S *end* I agree; begin *end*
Done *end*
What is its import *end*
C *end* The Lord *end*
S *end* Gives Pass grip *end* What is this *end*
C *end* The Pass Grip leading from the First to the Second Degree *end*
S *end* What does it demand *end*
C *end* A Pass Word *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* Give me that Word *end*
C *end* Thelema *end*
S *end* What is its import *end*
C *end* Will *end*
S *end* Pass Thelema *end*
E *end* takes C *end* to centre *end*
S *end* You now stand in the centre of our Camp the place of the Balance *end* Hear first the Book of the
Balance *end*
Orator who may be any member of the Oasis and is selected for the excellence of his delivery reads
Liber Librae — published in Equinox I *end*
S *end* Another and more serious obligation will now be required of you *end* Are you willing to take it *end*
C *end* I am *end*
S *end* Officers do your duty *end*
They go to Altar W *end* directs C *end* to place right hand on the Open Book *end* He places Dagger on C.’s heart
while E *end* presses Disk upon his head *end*
S *end* Repeat your name at length and say after me I .. *end* in the Presence of the Powers of Life visible and
invisible and of this Camp of Magicians do hereby and hereon most solemnly promise and swear

Never to reveal

What I learn beneath the seal

Within the guarded border

Of this Most Holy Order

Unless it be to a true brother



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
And not another

And be lustrated

And consecrated

By high permission

A true Magician

Using a perfect portion

Of proper caution

That he be duly

Tested truly

By right divine

Of grip and sign

And of each word

That ye have heard

In full possession

Or else in session

Of such a Camp as this within whose border

I stand aspiring to the Holy Order

Which I do know

By the letters O.T.O *end*
S *end* Besides the Oath of Secrecy there are certain obligations designed to make you more efficient in your
Way as in ours *end* Are you willing to take these *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
C *end* I am *end*
S *end* Say after me I solemnly pledge myself to know to will to dare and to keep silence *end* These several
points I solemnly swear to observe under no less a penalty than that of having my Breast cut across my
Heart torn therefrom and thrown to the fowls of the air that they may devour it *end*
Seal twice on CCXX — The Book of the Law — lifting Book to Lips *end*
Your first act will now be to join in our declaration of the Rights of Man *end* This you will sign in triplicate
with your full name and address; one copy we retain; the others are to be affixed publicly to edifices
symbolizing the civil and religious authority *end*
All raise the right hand C *end* holding Book *end* All repeat

There is no God but Man *end*
Man has the right to live by his own law *end*
Man has the right to live in the way that he wills to do *end*
Man has the right to dress as he wills to do *end*
Man has the right to dwell where he wills to dwell *end*
Man has the right to move as he will on the face of the earth *end*
Man has the right to eat what he will *end*
Man has the right to drink what he will *end*
Man has the right to think what he will *end*
Man has the right to speak as he will *end*
Man has the right to write as he will *end*
Man has the right to mould as he will *end*
Man has the right to carve as he will *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Man has the right to work as he will *end*
Man has the right to rest as he will *end*
Man has the right to love as he will when where and whom he will *end*
Man has the right to die when and how he will *end*
Man has the right to kill those who would thwart these rights *end*
O.T.O *end* applause *end*
S *end* Sign *end*
C *end* signs *end* W *end* takes papers *end*
S *end* In the Name of the Secret Master

Puts Book to his brow *end*
In the name of the O.T.O *end*
Puts Dagger to throat *end*
By the authority of the Grand Master Baphomet *end*
Puts Disk to heart *end*
S *end* I consecrate you a Magician *end*
O.T.O *end* applause *end*
I now gird you with this sacred sword; for you will have need of it *end* I appoint you sentinel of this Camp
while we enjoy the siesta of noon *end*
E *end* leads C *end* to door and bids him guard it with his face outwards *end*
The Orator now reads one of the following

Dolores Swinburne



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Orpheus’ Invocation of Aphrodite *end* Crowley

omitting the last verse

Orpheus’ Hymn Roll Strong Life Current Crowley

We have Seen Thee O Love from Atlanta Swinburne

Isis I am from Tannhauser Crowley

My Soul is an Enchanted Boat Crowley

Uncharmable Chamber Crowley

THIRD POINT The Ordeal

S *end* Comrades let us refresh ourselves at the sacred well *end*
All group about Well except C *end* and drink guarding each other *end*
E *end* Most Mysterious Master the Sentinel needs refreshment *end*
S *end* Let him drink of the Well *end*
All resume seats except W *end* and E *end* who lead C *end* to Well *end* They put his hands on the edges so that he has
to bend over to get his mouth to the water *end* Either he overbalances or they tip him in *end* He is left to
scramble out as best he can *end*
A Pause *end*
S *end* Brother Magician it is legitimate to gratify thirst but it is wise to observe precaution *end* Either from
your own lack of balance or from the malice of others you may find yourself in a disgraceful
humiliating and ridiculous position even should you be fortunate to escape more serious injury *end* You
must learn to do a given thing in a given way at a given time *end* Fellow-soldiers let the candidate be
instructed in the proper method of satisfying thirst *end*
W *end* and E *end* do this as in Opening C *end* replacing S *end* The wine in this degree is sweet red wine or
champagne *end*
S *end* You will now retire from the Camp; on your return I shall communicate to you the secrets of our
Order in this degree *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Done *end*
FOURTH POINT The Consecration and Instruction

S *end* On C.’s return *end* O Lord of all Magick I hereby invoke upon this candidate the Powers of the
Sphinx *end* May he acquire Knowledge Will Courage and Silence to the Glory of Thine Ineffable Name *end*
AUM *end*
The following passage is to be inserted as soon as a proper boulometer is ready *end* The boulometer consists
of an attachment to the thumb with a screw and a graduated wheel *end* C *end* has to turn the screw as far as he
can and his ability to do so is marked on the scale and recorded *end* When he desists S *end* says

S *end* This then is the measure of your courage will and power to keep silence *end* Now let me show you *end*
S *end* adjusts boulometer and screws it to the end *end*
S *end* My brother if you had had Knowledge you would have known how to adjust this screw so that it was
out of gear *end*
S *end* Send the candidate on his travels with the Sun *end*
W *end* and E *end* conduct him deosil seven circles of seven years *end*
The Orator reads the Prayers of the Elementals from Levi *end*
S *end* I now proceed to instruct you in the Secrets of this degree *end* Advance to me as at your Lustration *end*
Done

You will now take a second step as before but with the other foot; it is in this position that the secrets of
the degree are communicated *end* They consist of a Sign a Grip and a Word *end* The Sign is twofold *end* The first
part is called the Sign of Life or of Manifestation *end* It is given by clenching the fingers of both hands the
right hand to be held with the upper arm forming a square with the shoulder and the lower arm vertical;
the left hand is placed at the base of the torso *end* This is the characteristic position of the principal Gods of
Egypt *end*
The second part is called the Sign of Death and is given by dropping the left hand to the side and with
the other giving the motion of stabbing the heart *end* It alludes to the penalty of your obligation *end*
The Grip is given as before but by offering the thumb and with six pressures only *end* This Grip demands a



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Word *end* This Word is .. *end* which means The Lord *end*
As in the Minerval Degree it is the universal name or title of the Most High *end*
Send the candidate on his travels with the Sun *end*
S *end* Gives grip *end* What is this *end*
E *end* For C *end* The Grip or Token of a Magician *end*
S *end* What does it demand *end*
E *end* For C *end* A Word *end*
S *end* Give me that Word *end*
E *end* For C *end* At my initiation I was taught to be cautious *end* I will letter it with you *end*
S *end* I agree; begin *end*
Done *end*
What is its import *end*
E *end* For C *end* The Lord *end* Leaves C *end* to W *end*
S *end* Pass *end*
W *end* Noble Emir I present to you a Magician on his Consecration *end*
E *end* I will thank him to advance to me as a Magician *end*
Done *end*
W *end* For C *end* who repeats *end* I have *end*
E *end* Rising with Grip *end* What is this *end*
W *end* For C *end* The Grip or Token of a Magician *end*
E *end* What does it demand *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
W *end* For C *end* A Word *end*
E *end* Give me that Word *end*
W *end* For C *end* At my initiation I was taught to be cautious; I will letter it with you *end*
E *end* I agree; begin *end*
Done *end*
Its import *end*
W *end* For C *end* The Lord *end*
W *end* leaves C *end*
E *end* Pass *end* He rises and conducts C *end* round to W *end*
E *end* Worthy Wazir I present to you a Magician on his Consecration *end*
W *end* I will thank him to advance to me as a Magician *end*
Done *end*
What is that *end*
E *end* For C *end* The second regular step *end*
W *end* Do you bring anything else *end*
E *end* For C *end* I do *end*
Gives Sign *end*
W *end* What is that *end*
E *end* For C *end* The sign of a Magician *end*
W *end* To what does it allude *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
E *end* For C *end* To the penalty of my Obligation *end*
W *end* Have you anything to communicate *end*
E *end* For C *end* I have *end*
Gives Grip *end*
W *end* What is that *end*
E *end* For C *end* The Grip or Token of a Magician *end*
W *end* What does it demand *end*
E *end* For C *end* A Word *end*
W *end* Give me that Word *end*
E *end* For C *end* At my initiation I was taught to be cautious; I will letter it with you *end*
W *end* I agree; begin *end*
Done *end*
Its import *end*
E *end* For C *end* The Lord *end*
E *end* leaves C *end*
W *end* Pass *end*
Takes C *end* round and to S *end*
Most Mysterious Master I present to you a Magician on his Consecration that he may receive a mark of
your favour on his travels with the Sun *end*
S *end* My brother in the First Degree you were presented with a robe of darkness indeed yet in the shape
thereof was concealed a certain invocation of the Light *end* To those who thus invoke the Light light comes *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
I therefore affix this red triangle the apex pointing downwards as it were a wedge of Light splitting the
clouds that surround birth and warming life with its rays As it is written ‘The Sun of Righteousness
shall arise with healing in His wings’ *end* This triangle is also the special symbol of the Lord of the Aeon —
Ra-Hoor-Khuit; the Crowned and Conquering Child — the eternal Sun that dieth not whom we adore *end* I
also gird you with this Sword which you are to keep sharp and bright neither to draw without need nor
to sheath not without honour *end*
Be seated Brother Magician *end*
Orator reads Constitution *end*
S *end* It is an immemorial custom among us so that the memory of man runneth not to the contrary for the
newly made Magician to offer a Banquet to the officers of the Oasis *end*
You have signified your intention to conform to this custom and the business of the evening being
completed we may pass from labour to refreshment *end*
Identical with Opening then Close as in First Degree *end*
CLOSING



sroto_notes

 *end* Also known by the title of MAGICIAN *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
PART TWO

The Rituals Themselves



THIRD DEGREE

Prefatory Note

The Word of the Third Degree is one of the most closely guarded secrets of the O.T.O *end* I have had what is
alleged to be this Word communicated to me but as I am uncertain of the purity of the source from
which I received it I have not reproduced it *end*
Readers of this book who are students of qabalistic numerology will be able to reconstruct this word
however for it has four letters and its numeration is  the same as that of the key Thelemite words of
Thelema and Agape *end*
Third Degree

OPENING

The Oasis is open in the Second Degree *end* The C *end* has been given the Pass Word etc *end* The Tent has been
moved to the West of the Well facing East *end* The WELL is dry *end* S *end* crosses his hands right over left; W *end*
and E *end* take them and uncross them again *end* They then hold them above his head through save as stated *end*
S *end* A *end*
W *end* U *end*
E *end* M *end*
All Simultaneously *end* AUM *end*
S *end* Rises *end* Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law *end*
W *end* Rises *end* Love is the Law *end*
E *end* Rises *end* Love under will *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* Fellow soldiers assist me *end* What is the first duty of a Master Magician *end*
W *end* Most Mysterious Master to guard the Camp *end*
S *end* Let the Camp be guarded *end*
Done *end*
W *end* Most Mysterious Master the Camp is duly guarded *end*
S *end* The next duty *end*
E *end* To see that all present are Master Magicians *end*
S *end* To order fellow soldiers *end*
Pose and Sign *end*
How many officers has the Camp *end*
W *end* Three visible *end*
E *end* And eight invisible *end*
S *end* Brethren I am weary *end* I pray you bring me water from the well *end*
They leave him and report *end*
W *end* Most Mysterious Master there is no water in the well *end*
S *end* I pray you brethren seek diligently *end*
Done *end*
E *end* Most Mysterious Master there is a trace of moisture in one corner of the well *end*
S *end* I pray you give me to drink thereof *end*
E *end* brings the cup which is of blood and laudanum *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* My brethren the draught is right bitter *end*
They replace cup and return *end*
S *end* I pray you hold up mine hands *end*
Done *end* S *end* catches the support of the Tent and disjoints it thus causing the tent to fall behind him *end* They
then aid him to grope his way to the altar in the East *end* As he falls to his knees he grasps the candle stick *end*
S *end* Fellow-soldiers the King is dead *end*
All Long live the King *end*
O.T.O *end* applause *end*
First point Examination *end*
Second point The Oath *end*
Third point The Ordeal *end*
Fourth point Instruction *end*
DEVOTION

The place is open in the Second Degree *end*
FIRST POINT

S *end* Fellow-soldiers Brother .. *end* is to be devoted this night to Our Mystery; he must first give proofs of his
worthiness *end* I will therefore put the necessary questions *end*
C *end* brought by E *end*
S *end* How were you prepared to be consecrated a Magician *end*
C *end* Having been taught previously *end* I obtained the four powers of the Sphinx *end*
S *end* Which are *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
C *end* Knowledge Will Courage and Silence *end*
S *end* In the Latin language these are *end*
C *end* Scire Velle Audere Tacere *end*
S *end* Their initials are identical with those of what sentence *end*
C *end* Sub Umbra Alarum Tetragrammaton or Tahuti the Master of Magic *end*
S *end* Have you completed your travels with the Sun *end*
C *end* I have fulfilled seventy years *end*
S *end* The sun is setting *end* Do you pledge your might as a Magician that you will steadily persevere through
the ceremony of Devotion to the Degree of a Master Magician *end*
C *end* I do *end*
S *end* This .. *end* didst .. *end* thou .. *end* well *end*
Pause *end*
Do you likewise pledge yourself under the penalty of your obligation that you will conceal what I shall
now impart to you with the same strict caution as our other secrets *end*
C *end* I do *end*
S *end* Then I will entrust you with the Pass Grip and Pass Word leading to the Degree to which you seek
admission *end*
The Pass Grip is given by joining hands as you have been taught and twisting the wrist sharply to the
left *end* The Pass Word is AGAPE which means LOVE in the Greek language *end* Look frankly and fearlessly
into my eyes and say with me There is the dove and there is the serpent *end* Choose ye well *end* You will now
retire from the Camp to a place prepared there to undergo the necessary preparations for your Devotion *end*
E *end* takes out C *end*
SECOND POINT

C *end* is prepared by having cords with heavy weights totalling  pounds attached to his shoulders



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
wrists waist and ankles *end* The Camp is opened in the Third Degree *end* E *end* goes out prepares C *end* and knocks
thrice *end*
During the preparation all chant solemnly ‘Abide with Me’ *end* etc *end*
W *end* opens door *end*
W *end* Whom have you there *end*
E *end* A Magician who devoted himself to our Mystery *end*
W *end* HALT *end* W *end* applies Dagger and Disk to Umbilicus of C *end*
S *end* Do you vouch that he is properly prepared *end*
W *end* I do *end*
S *end* Admit him in due form *end*
C *end* is led to throne by E *end*
S *end* Gives Grip *end* What is this *end*
C *end* The Grip or Token of a Magician *end*
S *end* What does it demand *end*
C *end* A word *end*
S *end* Give me that word *end*
C *end* At my initiation I was taught to be cautious; I will letter it with you *end*
S *end* I agree; begin *end*
Done *end*
S *end* What is its import *end*
C *end* The Lord *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* Gives Pass-grip *end* What is this *end*
C *end* The Pass-grip leading from the Second to the Third degree *end*
S *end* What does it demand *end*
C *end* A Pass-word *end*
S *end* Give me that Pass-word *end*
C *end* Agape *end*
S *end* What is its import *end*
C *end* Love *end*
S *end* Pass Agape *end*
E *end* takes C *end* to centre *end*
S *end* Another yet more serious obligation will now be demanded of you; are you willing to take it *end*
C *end* I am *end*
S *end* Officers do your duty *end*
C *end* is led about the camp widdershins his face covered with his own robe while all chant *end* O Lord
Deliver me etc *end*
S *end* The Candidate is ready to take the Great Oath *end*
W *end* Repeats very solemnly with strong affirmative *end*
E *end* Repeats yet more mournfully affirmative *end*
S *end* You will place both hands on the Book of the Law while the disk is applied to your navel *end*
Repeat your name at length and say after me I .. *end* in the presence of the Powers of Death visible and
invisible and of this Secret place of Masters in the Camp of Magicians do hereby and hereon most
solemnly promise and swear



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Never to reveal

What I learned beneath the Seal

Within the guarded border

Of this Most Holy Order

Unless it be to a True Brother

And not another

And he lustrated

And consecrated

By high permission

A True Magician

And through disaster

A proven Master

Using a perfect portion

Of proper caution

That he be duly

Tested truly

By right divine

Of Grip and Sign *end*
And of each word

That ye have heard



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
In full possession

Or else in session

Of such a Camp as this within whose border

I stand aspiring to the Holy Order

Which I do know

By the letters O.T.O *end*
S *end* Besides the Oath of Secrecy there are further Oaths peculiar to this degree *end* You have already
without knowing it involved yourself in the necessity of taking them *end* For who understandeth the full end
of all his acts *end*
Say after me

I further solemnly pledge myself / to obey the Grand Master Baphomet; / to recognize his authority / and
his alone; / without regular charter from him / I will not initiate / or purport to initiate / any person / into
any association / of any kind / or administer any ceremony / identical with / or resembling in any way /
the Ceremonies of Our Order *end* / I promise always to look with respect and reverence / upon the members
of higher grades / and to aspire steadfastly / and with modesty / to be received into their number *end* /

I further solemnly pledge myself / so to apply the Four Powers of the Sphinx / as to obtain full control /
over my subtle body / so that I may travel freely therein / upon all spheres as I will / whether my present
physical body / be alive or no *end* /

I further solemnly pledge myself / to maintain the Seven Bonds of Brotherhood; in act as well as in word *end*
/

My hand shall grip in sure relation

As of true brother with true brother;

My foot shall be the firm foundation

Of our straight walking with each other;

My knee bend not in supplication



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Either to him or to another

My body shall not do him wrong;

My breast shall keep his secrets close;

My mouth shall speak him truth in song

My arm defend him from his foes *end*
S *end* places his hands on C’s and adds weight to his emphasis *end*
S *end* Most especially / will I keep secret the knowledge / of the Word of this Degree; / I will never utter it /
so long as I shall live / except at the proper moment / when acting as Master / of a Secret Place of
Masters / in a camp of True Magicians / warranted by charter / under the hand and seal of Baphomet; /
lest its sacred virtue be impaired *end*
All these points / I solemnly swear to observe / under no less a penalty / than that of being stabbed / in
the bowels / and my carcass / burned to ashes / that no trace or remembrance of so vile a wretch / may
remain among men / especially Master Magicians *end* /

Seal thrice on CCXX dropping head to Book *end*
In the Name of the Secret Master

Puts Book to his brow *end*
In the name of the O.T.O *end*
Puts Dagger to throat *end*
By the authority of the Grand Master Baphomet *end*
Puts Disk to heart *end*
I proclaim you devoted a Master Magician *end*
C *end* rises *end* The officers give him the kiss of peace *end*
THIRD POINT



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* O thou *end* Lord of the West *end* I hereby invoke upon this Candidate the Powers of Death as he offers
himself to partake with us the Mysterious Secrets of a Master Magician *end* Endue him with such fortitude
that in the hour of trial he fall not but that passing safely under Our protection through the Valley of the
Shadow of Death he may rise from the tomb of transgression to shine as the Stars forever and ever *end*
Aumn *end* Send the Candidate on his last journey with the Sun *end*
W *end* precedes and E *end* follows him; they go widdershins *end* Solemn and slow music; or S *end* recites the

Invocation to Hecate from Orpheus *end*
W *end* Most Mysterious Master the Candidate approaches the end of his last journey with the Sun *end*
S *end* Our Brother is weary; let him be refreshed with meat and Drink *end*
W *end* gives him a piece of bread dipped in the bitter cup *end*
The weights are removed *end*
S *end* You are now entitled to demand that last and greatest trial by which you can be admitted to the
SECRETS OF THIS DEGREE *end*
S *end* At your Lustration you a naked soul put on the frail garment of a mortal body *end* In the Second Degree
you were taught how to live; in the Third you will be finally instructed how to die *end*
S *end* Is the Candidate prepared *end*
E *end* The Sun was his Father and the Moon his mother *end*
W *end* Earth was his nurse Air bore him in its bosom *end*
E *end* He has been purified with water *end*
W *end* He hath been thrice proclaimed *end*
S *end* Then let him be adorned with the insignia of his rank *end*
They take these insignia from S *end* and invest C *end* then setting him upon the throne of S *end*
S *end* Hail O Most Mysterious Master *end*
All Most Mysterious Master hail all hail *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* Most Mysterious Master what rites do we that are Master Magicians celebrate in this Secret Place *end*
C *end* I know not *end*
S *end* We are met to commemorate the death of Mansur el-Hallaj *end*
W *end* An ignorant imposter hath intruded into our Camp *end*
E *end* Nay hath seized upon the very throne of the Most Mysterious Master *end*
S *end* Let him be stripped of his ornaments and bound to the Pole of My tent *end*
Done *end*
S *end* What does he merit who hath usurped the Power of the Master *end*
W *end* Death *end*
E *end* Wait *end* Let us remember the purpose for which we are to come together *end*
S *end* It is Well *end*
Pause *end*
S *end* Mansur el-Hallaj was an initiate of our Holy Order and had come to full comprehension of his nature *end*
He was therefore wont to cry aloud in the market-place of his City I am the Truth and in my Turban is
wrapped nothing but God *end* The ignorant and unworthy populace began to accuse him of blasphemy so
that a council of twelve elders was convened to consider his case *end* Our Brother was acquitted by the votes
of nine of these men three only being for his execution but even the majority adjudged him guilty of
imprudence and sentenced him to be bound to a pole or cross there to be mocked and scourged and spat
upon *end*
Done *end* C *end* has to erect pole himself *end*
S *end* Let the Candidate be released *end*
Done *end*
My Brother let me congratulate you upon the fortitude with which you have undergone the same
punishment as our ancient Master *end* This wise man profiting by the lesson so severely taught him
refrained from further imprudence and retired to an Oasis in the Desert where was a Well *end* In this



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
secluded spot it became his custom to greet the Sun at noon with these words I am the Truth and in my
Turban is wrapped nothing but God *end*
During this C *end* is led to the Well *end*
But the Master had not reckoned upon the malice of those three men implacable and atrocious *end* They
took counsel together and since they could not gratify their hatred by judicial means resolved upon no
less a crime than his assassination *end* Being informed by spies of the Secret Place where they might find the
Master they repaired thither and discovered him at the hour of sunset in the very act of adoration *end*
Gives Life Sign of Second Degree *end* C *end* imitates him *end*
Thus the first advancing upon him cried ‘Who art thou?’ to which Our Brother in his ecstasy replied ‘I
am the Truth and in my Turban is wrapped nothing but God’ *end* Upon this the assassin hurled a stone
which struck him upon the left breast throwing him to the ground *end*
Done *end*
Satisfied with the success of his abominable design the murderer retired; but the second assassin
approaching saw that Our Brother had recovered himself; and in his turn cried ‘Who art thou?’ So fixed
was Our Brother in his realization that he replied as before ‘I am the Truth and in my Turban is wrapped
nothing but God’ *end* The villain enraged at such persistence picked up a stone and hurled it *end* It struck Our
Brother upon the right breast once more hurling him to the ground *end*
Done *end*
It was now the turn of the arch assassin and prime mover of this crime to assure himself that Our Brother
was dead; but on his approach he found that although faint and bleeding from the determined assaults
upon him he had staggered to his feet so that he might pay proper salutation to the Sun with whom he
knew himself one and individible *end* The furious wretch exclaimed ‘Who art thou?’ and Our Brother with
a supreme effort fixed his eyes upon the last ray of the sun as it sank and cried ‘I am the Truth and in
my Turban is wrapped nothing but God’ *end*
At that the chief of the assassins picked up yet another stone which struck Our Brother on the forehead
and laid him lifeless at his feet *end*
Done *end*
Then to make double sure he stabbed the Master in the throat with a dagger and his blood gushed out
upon the disk or platter from which he was wont to eat *end* Summoning his accomplices he directed them to
conceal the corpse within the Well of the Oasis *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Done *end*
Which although it had served to quench his thirst for many days was found to be entirely dry as though
it had expired in sympathy with him *end* Now the evening having fallen it came to pass that the disciples of
Our Brother became alarmed at his continued absence and they organized a party to seek him *end* These
men divided themselves into four sections to proceed to the Well each to a cardinal point of the
compass *end* A little before dawn they again met at the Well to report the result of their search *end*
Worthy Wazir have you sought to the North of the Well *end*
W *end* I have *end*
S *end* What did you find *end*
W *end* No trace of Our Brother *end*
S *end* Noble Emir have you sought to the East of the Well *end*
E *end* I have *end*
S *end* What did you find *end*
E *end* No trace of Our Brother *end*
S *end* Worthy Wazir have you sought to the South of the Well *end*
W *end* I have *end*
S *end* What did you find *end*
W *end* No trace of Our Brother *end*
S *end* Noble Emir have you sought to the West of the Well *end*
E *end* I have *end*
S *end* What did you find *end*
E *end* No trace of Our Brother *end*
S *end* Then let us seek him within the Well itself *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
They raise the coping stone *end*
S *end* Brethren the Master is slain yet his Word lives for here behold is written in his blood upon the
floor of this dry well ‘An’el Haqq’ which is to say ‘I am the Truth’ Noble Emir do you know the
Word by which man is raised from death to life *end*
E *end* I do *end*
S *end* Make trial of that Word *end*
Word of First *end*
E *end* The Word is in vain *end*
Repeat with W *end* and Word of Second *end*
E *end* Shall nothing endure but the Truth *end*
W *end* Will you not make trial of the Word of a Master Magician *end*
S *end* It is my will *end*
W *end* and E *end* take C *end* from Well and support him *end*
I am bound to Our Brother by Seven Bonds of Brotherhood *end*
My hand gripped his in sure relation *end*
Point by point done as said *end*
As of true brother with true brother;

My foot was ever firm foundation

Of our straight walking with each other;

My knee bent not in supplication

Either to him or to another *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
My body did not do him wrong;

My bosom kept his secrets close;

My mouth spoke forth his truth in song;

My arm his warden from his foes *end*
E *end* And do these bonds endure through time *end*
S *end* Noble Emir they do *end*
W *end* How so *end*
S *end* By virtue of the word of a Master Magician *end*
The first letter is of silence *end*
Pause *end*
The second is of breath .. *end*
Our Brother breathes *end*
The third letter is of going .. *end*
Our brother moves *end*
The fourth letter is of generation *end*
Our brother stands rejoicing *end*
Word *end*
All He lives in the son *end*
O.T.O *end* applause *end* All return *end*
S *end* Let the Candidate be taken from the Secret Place and restored to his former attire as a magician; after
which I will confer upon him the keys to the treasure of Our Sacred Knowledge *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Done *end*
S *end* I now entrust you with the Secrets of this Degree *end* Advance to me as a Magician *end*
FOURTH POINT

Done *end*
You will now take a third step as before with the left foot; for Three represents the return of the Two to
the One but after another manner *end* And herein lieth a great Mystery beyond the understanding even of a
Master Magician *end*
It is in this position that the Secrets of this Degree are communicated *end*
They consist of a Sign a Grip and a Word *end* As in the First Degree the sign was single in the Second
double so in the Third Degree it is triple *end*
FIRST is the Sign of Mystery *end* Clenching the fingers of the right hand touch with the thumb the
forehead the right breast the left breast and finally the throat *end* This is in commemoration of the wounds
of the Ancient Master and by their position they form a triangle with a point in the focus thereof which
is called CENTRUM IN TRIGONO CENTRI *end*
SECOND is the Sign of Resurrection *end* Clenching the right hand as usual touch the navel with the thumb *end*
Then draw the hand sharply across the body and drop it smartly to the side; then bring it upwards with a
curving motion slowly to the navel *end* This sign demands a word and this word is AN’EL HAQQ *end* The
other replies I am the Truth and within my Turban is wrapped nothing but God *end*
THIRD is the Sign of Brotherhood; which includes the Grip *end* This is given by approaching with clenched
hands backs upwards and then reciprocally grasping the thumbs *end* Three distinct pressures are then given *end*
One says

‘I give my hand in sure relation.’

The other answers

‘As of true brother with true brother.’

Approach the feet so that the right foot of each is between the two feet of the other *end* One says

‘I pledge my foot for firm foundation.’



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
The other answers

‘Of our straight walking with each other.’

Touch the right knees and say together

‘My knees bend not in supplication

Either to you or to another’ *end*
Advancing the lower part of the torso say

‘My body doth not do you wrong.’

The other advancing the breast replies

‘My bosom keeps your secrets close.’

The first putting his mouth to the other’s ear

‘My mouth speaks to you truth in song.’

The second putting his mouth to the ear of the first while both throw the left arm over the back of the
other

‘My arm defends you from your foes.’

This Sign and Grip combined demands a Word *end* It is the Word by which I raised you the Word by which
we triumph over death *end* This word is too sacred to utter on any other occasion; and you will therefore say
instead of it a sentence whose initials are formed from the letters of the Word taken in reverse order
This sentence is .. *end* which means

Now is the blessing of Death at hand *end*
Be seated Brother Master Magician in the throne of the Most Mysterious Master of the Secret Place of
Masters *end*
Done *end*
S *end* I am now to impress upon you the Nature of the Bonds which link the Brethren of this Degree *end* By the
union of hands we affirm that the hand given to a Master Magician is a sure pledge of brotherhood and



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
that it shall never take weapon to assail him; the union of feet is to declare that each shall support his
Brother Master Magician in the Way of his Going; the union of knees that each shall be self-reliant and
independent not allowing mutual help to destroy mutual self-respect; and affirming that every man and
every woman is a star responsible to itself alone co-equal and co-eternal with every other God *end* The
union of bodies signifies that the use of the bodily functions shall be such as to bring no grief to any
Brother Master Magician or to them of his household; but rather freedom in rejoicing *end* The union of
breasts implies the unison of the hearts of all True Brethren the love that inspires them and the sanctity
of the confidence between them *end* The union of mouths affirms that Master Magicians will speak the truth
one to another and one of another; while the arm thrown over the back of a brother asserts that each will
guard the other in his absence as in his presence and defend his honour as if it were his own *end* In
particular he is to be at pains to repel the slanderer of his Brother’s good name informing that Brother
immediately of the name of his Slanderer and the matter of the slander and not allowing himself to be
tricked into a pledge of secrecy *end* I ask you Brother Master Magician if you clearly understand and
heartily agree these principles *end*
C *end* With sign *end* I do *end*
E *end* It now becomes my duty to inform you that the ceremony through which you have just passed is in
every essential the Lesser or Infernal Rite of the Slain God whose name is John or some sound similar
as Jonah Dionysus Janus Dianus Nu Anu Oannes On Noah and many others *end* This God of Water is
of the North because the Sun touches his Northern limit as he enters the watery sign Cancer and turns
towards the South represented by the Goat-Gods Set Had Hades Adad Odin Adonis Adonii Atys
etc *end* who are of the earthly sign Capricornus the southern limit of the Sun’s journey *end* As the end of
Summer is in Libra the cardinal sign of air the Gods of Water partake also of the airy nature and
similarly the Earthy Gods have their natures intermixed with fire since the end of Winter announces the
fiery sign of Aries whose mysteries are those of Spring and called the Greater Mysteries wherein the
Slain God is celebrated by his name Iao Jupiter Jehovah Iacchis Zeus Shu Jesus Osiris etc *end* The
ignorance of the vulgar and the corruption of the records have aided Time’s work of confusing the
doctrines so that the natures of distinct Gods have suffered the accretion of alien elements till their
simplicity has almost baffled restoration *end*
This Infernal Rite of which you are now an initiate is founded on the apparent tragedy of the fall of the
year seen as a catastrophe by ignorant minds though the philosophical comprehend the phenomenon as
the natural regular and recurrent change in the obliquity of the Earth’s Axis *end* With this ceremony of the
renewal of the life of the Sun is mingled that of what the wise men of old regarded as a similar tragedy
that of the death of man and his renewal ‘in the son’ *end* Let me ask you to consider Brother Master
Magician that as the solar tragedy is but the uninformed and partial views of acts so may the human
prove *end* Of this your progress in Our Order may give you opportunity to judge *end*
W *end* To S *end* Most Mysterious Master of the Time past will you not bequeath to your successor a double
portion of your spirit and bestow upon him from the shades a mark of your divine favour *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
S *end* It is my will *end*
Gives C *end* his insignia and affixes O.T.O *end*
Places candle in his hand *end*
W *end* To C *end* Most Mysterious Master the Secret Place of Masters is never closed *end* It is dissolved into
ecstasy and I request you to order that this may be done *end*
O.T.O *end* applause *end*
DISSOLUTION

W *end* Let the Word of the God John be heard of us *end*
Orator reads — I am that I am to end of Crowley’s Mystery-play The Ship *end*

 *end* Also known by the titles of MASTER MAGICIAN and DEVOTION *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
PART TWO

The Rituals Themselves



LODGE OF PERFECTION

and

FOURTH DEGREE

Holy Royal Arch of Enoch

Prefatory Note

The symbolism of this degree is based on that of the Holy Royal Arch degree of orthodox Freemasonry *end*
This is itself based on the Old Testament Haggai II v *end* - *end* The officers who operate the ritual H *end* J *end*
and Z *end* are then Haggai Joshua and Zerrubbabel *end*
The altar of this rite is a modified form of that of the Holy Royal Arch and without some description of
it both the opening of the Lodge of Perfection and its Mystical Lecture are incomprehensible *end*
The altar is in the form of a double cube its top about sixteen inches square and on it inscribed the
double triangle of the Seal of Solomon identical with the Shield of David found on the flag of Israel
within a circle *end* On this are placed at random the eight letters J A H B V L O and N; these represent
the corresponding Hebrew letters *end* At the conclusion of the ‘picking’ incident see opening the altar
looks like this



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
By keeping this diagram in mind the Mystical Lecture is easily interpreted *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Opening

Senior Perfect Magician Present Brethren the Grand Orient honours us *end* A Lodge of Perfection is to be
opened by .. *end* Member of the VIII° a delegate of the Supreme Grand Council of the Sovereign Grand
Inspectors General *end* Brethren draw the Sword *end* Let us receive our august visitor beneath the Arch of
Steel *end*
Fanfare *end* Enter beneath arch VIII° preceded by Herald with trumpet and banner and followed by two
IV° with drawn swords *end* They take place by the altar *end* Fanfare *end*

It is now useful to inform you that these degrees are never worked *end* But their secrets form intermediate
steps between our third and fourth degrees and it is therefore necessary to confer them formally upon
you *end* The Lodge of Perfection is however a natural and necessary step in our sublime system; its secrets
are important to every Master Magician; for they concern the Sacred and Mysterious Name of the True
and Living God Most High *end*
You will therefore retire from the Lodge and prepare yourselves under supervision for the most solemn
moment of your lives *end*

Shoes off ‘Take thy shoes from off thy feet; for the place whereunto thou approachest is holy ground.’

your l.h *end* cover it with your right repeat your name at length and say after me

I .. *end* in the presence of the Powers of the Word and of this L *end* of P *end* duly constituted consecrated and
congregated of my own free will and accord do hereunder and hereon solemnly promise and swear that I
will always hele conceal and never reveal any of the secrets or mysteries of this supreme degree to any
one in the world unless it be a true lawful and perfect Magician and not even to him until after due
trial strict examination and full conviction that he is worthy of that confidence or in the body of a Lodge
of P.M.s *end* duly opened beneath the Vault of Heaven *end*
I further solemnly pledge myself never to pronounce that Solemn and Mysterious Name which may now
for the first time be communicated to me unless in the presence and with the assistance of two or more
P.M.s *end*
All these points I solemnly swear to observe without evasion equivocation or mental reservation of any
kind under the penalty of having my skull sawn off and my brains exposed to the searing rays of the Sun *end*
Amen *end*
You will seal this solemn oath  times with your lips on the V.S.L *end*

The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
° in the darkness of death *end*

 letters wherein are many mysteries concealed while the whole forms the S *end* and M.N *end* of
T.T.A.L.G.M.H *end* I now proceed to confer upon you the secrets of this degree *end*
First is the P.S *end* given by &c *end* It alludes to the p *end* of your o *end* and also to the shielding of the eyes from the
brilliance of the WORD *end*
Second is the Reverential sign or sign of adoration given by &c *end* as if overcome by adoration and
ecstasy *end*
Third is the sign of admiration or thanksgiving given by &c *end*
Fourth is the Monitorial sign given by r.h *end* on h.; h-d on l.h *end* in allusion to the weariness of heart and



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
brain which must suffer in our search for the Word *end*
Fifth is the Fiducial sign given by &c *end* and sweeping the hand down and back as if tearing down a veil *end*
Done *end*
Behold in silence and adore *end* Blessed are the eyes that have beheld the ineffable *end*
Z *end* H *end* P *end* Communicate the Word as in opening *end*
Listen in silence and adore *end* Blessed are the ears that have heard the Invisible *end*
You will now retire by seven steps halting and bowing at the rd  and  after which you will take
your seat in this L *end* of P *end* and attend to the Lecture *end*
IV°

Lodge of Perfection

THE LECTURE

CLOSING

THE MYSTICAL LECTURE

I

Brother Perfect Magician and Companion of the Holy Royal Arch of Enoch in the third degree a word
was communicated to you which if properly understood should acquaint you thoroughly with the real
secret of life its true meaning *end* If you understand that word you will be indeed able to say ‘Oh death
where is thy sting *end* Oh grave where is thy victory?’ not merely with triumph but with contempt such as
may have been felt of old by a faithful knight who dressed in the armour of his monarch was slain in
mistake for him *end*
If you have not understood that word these expressions will appear strange to you *end* In either case it is
merely necessary that you should know that while the word of that degree sums up human nature the
word of this degree is the synthesis of the divine *end*
Man is the microcosm a perfect mirror of that universe for which one name is God *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
The word upon the altar is then a hieroglyph of the microcosm; and all its secrets are therein contained *end*
II

Accordingly we find the word of a Minerval once more in the very centre of all and you will recollect
that this word ON means the Sun *end*
However this is not all *end* ON in Hebrew is a most secret and holy name of God its numerical value is
 a number produced by multiplying together the first five numbers or by adding together the first  *end*
This  again is produced by adding the first  *end* There are many other important considerations to be
made concerning this word and this number which may safely be left to the ardours of your research *end*
This Sun is in the midst of the  other letters of the word; and the general knowledge of correspondences
which you have derived from the study of the books appointed for your instruction will at once show you
that

J is Virgo the Virgin Moon

A is the Fool or Antic the antique or ancient one Saturn

H is the letter of Aries the house of Mars

B is the letter of Mercury

V is the Hierophant or Pope emblem of Jupiter

L is Libra the house of Venus

Such my brother are the letters taken singly *end* In combination we reach beyond the simple facts of nature
to divine mysteries *end*
III

First of all consider the descending triangle *end* It reads IHV the first three letters of the ineffable name of
four letters *end* They refer to Father Mother Son as your earliest studies in the Qabalah acquainted you *end*
You will compare this with the word of the ° *end* It is further of the very greatest importance to remember
that the three principal officers of the Royal Arch represent the three functions of Prophet Priest and
King *end* Now in the Tarot J *end* is the Hermit the ‘Prophet of the Eternal’; H *end* is the Emperor and V *end* the
Hierophant Pope or High Priest *end*
Now the left side of the Triangle L.J.A *end* =  = Ma the Mother while A.I.L *end* means a stag goat or ram
from the curved horns of those animals and therefore means the Father and ‘the Beginning of Whirling



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Motion’ *end* God says Proclus is he having a spiral force *end* The right side A.H.B *end* means ‘love’ *end*
The base B.V.L *end* means ‘on high’ *end*
In all ‘the love of the supernal mother-father’ *end*
You will further recognize in J.A.H *end* a name of God so sacred that the Hebrews dared not utter it and
dare not to this day *end* It represents the Father and Mother conjoined with the Microcosm represented by
the letter A whose shape suggests the Pentagram the star of the Microcosm contained in that
conjunction *end* H.B.V *end* adds to  and thus expresses both Unity and Love while V.L.J *end* is  a female
slave here referring to the unenlightened soul *end*
Combining all this into a single sentence we read the Most High by Love and Unity exalts the Daughter
to the throne of the Mother *end* That is a pure rendering of the way of salvation by Samadhi or Union with
God in that particular image which you have studied in ‘The Vision and the Voice’ *end* Taking the name by
syllables we find Jah as before ‘The Most High’ *end* Bul means ‘Lord’ and also ‘on high’ in the Chaldean
Language while ON in Egyptian and Hebrew alike signifies the Sun the Lord of all *end* Thus in three
separate languages the Word testifies to the True and Living God Most High *end*
IV

We shall now consider the word taking two letters at a time from the angles of the triangle *end*
We saw that the descending triangle IHV expressed the human nature of God; the ascending triangle will
illustrate His nature in itself *end*
AB is Father BL Lord *end*
AL is Word or Logos Son BL Lord *end*
LB is Heart or Spirit BL Lord *end*
vvvv All rise *end* Glory to the Father and to the Son and to the Holy Ghost; as it was in the beginning

is now and ever shall be world end *end* Amen *end*
Sign of admiration *end*
Thus my brother does the Word of this degree declare the nature of the most Holy Trinity *end*
So much perhaps you were already aware of; for none can be more sensible than myself of the progress
you have made; yet it may possibly have escaped you that these same letters can be read in a sense



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
diametrically opposite to the first *end*
Thus AB the Father BA to come or go denies the permanence of the Father *end*
LA Not BL God *end* There is no God *end*
LB Heart BL Lord *end* The Heart is Lord *end*
The first of these phrases would seem to emphasize the lesson of the °; the second to make a statement
contradicting the very word in which it occurs surprising until you recollect the statement in The Vision
and the Voice that above the Abyss a fact is only true in so far as it contradicts itself; while the third is
another way of saying

Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law and this

The word of the Law is Thelema *end*
And this Love is the Law Love under Will *end*
Do not forget that the numeration of Thelema as also that of Agape Love or Charity in its best sense is
equivalent to that of the word of our ° *end*
It is further of interest to observe that these letters ABL added to  the number of the years of the life of
King Solomon’s Temple and that of Jesus Christ *end*  is also the number of degrees in Freemasonry; and
it has many other qualities many of which you doubtless know already *end*
Note too that A is  B  L  as if to signify the whole course of the universe the Unity the Dyad the
Many and the Naught *end*
It is also pertinent to observe that J is the Wand A the Pentagram or Pentacle H the Cup B the Crown
V the Sword and L the Balances while O and N symbolize other magical weapons of a still more secret
and important character *end*
V

But it would be useless to continue an analysis of a Word which includes all things human and divine
and in which every secret is concealed *end* Is not the wealth of the Divine inexhaustible *end* Can the square
define the Illimitable or the Compasses circumscribe Him *end* Unbegotten in Eternity beyond Time and
Space without quantity or quality sublime supreme inaccessible unknown with what words shall we
praise or with what thoughts comprehend His Majesty *end* Utterance must profane Him silence itself can
but bear witness to Him *end* How shall we extol Him *end* In what shall we shadow forth His glory *end* Though



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
your skull were smote off and your brain exposed to the scorching rays of the sun it were nothing to His
manifestation to your mortal mind *end*
Let us remember the penalty of our obligation gives sign and if ever we should incautiously think of
pronouncing that great name with lightness or irreverence place our finger upon our lips as it is written
Seal up thy lips lest thou speak it *end*


sroto_notes

 *end* Also known by the title of PERFECT MAGICIAN *end*

S *end* passes as before *end* Meanwhile nd O recites *end*
nd O Into my loneliness comes

The sound of a flute in dim groves that haunt the uttermost hills *end*
Even from the brave river they reach to the edge of the wilderness *end*
And I behold Pan *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
The snows are eternal above above —

And their perfume smokes ever into the nostrils of the stars *end*
But what have I to do with these *end*
To me only the distant flute the abiding vision of Pan *end*
On all sides Pan to the eye to the ear *end*
The perfume of Pan pervading the taste of him utterly filling my mouth so that the tongue breaks forth
into a weird and monstrous speech *end*
The embrace of him intense on every centre of pain and pleasure —

The six interior sense aflame with the inmost self of him —

Myself flung down the precipice of being —

Even to the abyss annihilation *end*
An end to loneliness as to all *end*
Pan *end* Pan *end* to Pan *end* to Pan *end*

PART TWO

The Rituals Themselves



FIFTH DEGREE

Form of the Petition

TO BE WRITTEN OUT AND SIGNED BY EVERY POSTULANT

I the undersigned request the Most Wise and Perfect Sovereign and the Very August Excellent
Puissant and Perfect Princes now assembled that you will be graciously pleased to admit me to your
Princely Order *end*
I trust that the sincerity of my endeavours to promote the Glory of the Rosie Cross and the Welfare of
Mankind will entitle me to your favourable opinions *end*
Assuring you that I shall not fail to redeem my pledge of allegiance to this Sovereign Chapter and to
devote my Rose and Cross to the prosperity and happiness of the Princes of this sublime degree I
subscribe myself *end*
Signed ....................... *end* IV°



THE FURNITURE OF A CHAPTER OF ROSE CROIX

RED ROOM

Altar *end* White silk altar-cloth with Rose  on gold cross  with  green rays *end*
Super-altar *end* Black *end*  steps *end* Copy of Stele of Revealing *end*  lights *end*  roses *end* Paten and
Chalice *end* Cakes of Light and Red Wine *end*
Optional *end* Crystal globe Image of Babalon &c *end* But no male symbol *end*
Thrones *end* One each side of the altar for M.W.S *end* and H.P *end* one in West for G.M *end*

The Brand *end*

THE

OPENING OF A

SOVEREIGN CHAPTER OF ROSE CROIX



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
M.W.S.Very excellent and Perfect Princes be pleased to assist me to open the Chapter of the Holy

Order of Rose Croix of Heredom *end*
All rise *end*
Very excellent and perfect Grand Marshal see that the Castle Gates are duly guarded and that all is
secure within *end*
The door is tested *end* The Grand Marshal receives the first three signs from all present *end*
G.M *end* All is secure both within and without *end*
M.W.S *end* What is the hour *end*
H.P *end* It is the hour when the Veil of the Temple was rent in twain

When darkness began to outspread the earth

When the altar was thrown down

The Star called Wormwood fell upon the earth

When the Blazing Star was eclipsed

The Sacred Tau was defiled with blood and water the word was lost and despair and tribulation visited
us *end*
Solemn musick *end*
M.W.S *end* Since the Royal Art has experienced such dire calamities it is our duty very Excellent and
Perfect Princes to retrieve the loss; and may the influence of Truth Silence and Love prosper our
endeavours to recover the Lost Word *end*
He lays down the Crucifix and tramples upon it *end*
Therefore with my heel upon the head of the Great Serpent I declare this Chapter of Rose Croix duly
opened in the name of BABALON and THE BEAST conjoined of the Secret Savior and of IAO *end*
Applause *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
H.P *end* Sits *end*
G.M *end* Sits *end*
All seat themselves *end*
RECEPTION OF POSTULANT

First Point

M.W.S *end* Very Excellent and Perfect Princes the business of this evening is the reception of Brother
Sister .. *end*
H.P *end* retires to Red Room or acts as introducer *end*
M.W.S *end* takes position on Tau setting up the .. *end* and placing the Crucifix on his breast *end*
G.M *end* draws sword and goes without veil *end* Introducer who has habited Postulant in white with IV°
apron and placed the V.S.L *end* in his hand takes the petition to G.M *end* who takes it to M.W.S *end* who says
‘Admit the Postulant!’ Introducer returns to Postulant and leads him amid strains of martial musick to
the outer veil *end* Then he knocks *end* G.M *end* draws veil *end*
G.M *end* Who are you *end*
Introducer A Member of the Body of Initiates *end*
G.M *end* Whither go you *end*
Introducer To the Immortal Mansions of Babalon *end*
G.M *end* What is your rank *end*
Introducer I am become a Perfect Magician *end*
G.M *end* Give me the sign *end*
Done *end*
Your petition has been favourably received by this Princely Chapter; but whilst we admire your zeal and
courage alas *end* you came amongst us at a time when we are overwhelmed by the deepest sorrow *end*
Consternation now spreads horror over our brows *end* An earthquake rends the fair breast of our mother and



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
the Head of the Great Serpent is exalted *end* The Veil of the Temple is rent asunder *end*
G.M *end* flings aside *end*
Our altars are thrown down; the sacred Tau is defiled with Blood and Water; the Star called Wormwood
is fallen upon the earth; and the Blazing Star is eclipsed *end*
Also the Word is lost *end*
Slow musick *end*
M.W.S *end* Nevertheless we rejoice that you have arrived at this hour of peril your strength and courage
may assist us to retrieve our loss and recover the Word *end*
Worthy Sir Noble Dame I direct you to travel  years  to the South  to the West  to the North
returning to me in the East to report the results of your travels *end*
G.M *end* leads Postulant  circles deosil and then takes him to the Southern Pillar where he finds T;
circles and to Western Pillar where he finds S;  circles and to Northern Pillar where he finds L *end* He is
then brought to head of M.W.S *end*
G.M *end* Holy Father I beg to present to you B.. *end* S.. *end* who has completed the  years travel imposed on
him or her *end*
M.W.S *end* What have you discovered *end*
Introducer I have searched in and about the Pillars in the South West and North for the Lost Word but
have only succeeded in finding the letters T *end* S *end* and L *end*
M.W.S *end* I congratulate you on the success which has already rewarded your exertions *end* These letters are
the initials of the virtues by whose assistance you may be led to the recovery of the Lost Word *end* T *end* stands
for Truth S *end* stands for Silence L *end* for Love while in conjunction .. *end* he checks himself *end* But before I can
explain myself further I must call upon you to take a solemn obligation to keep inviolate the Secrets and
Mysteries of our Holy Order *end* Are you willing to do this *end*
Postulant I am *end*
M.W.S *end* Then remove from my breast the heavy burden which oppresses me and cast it behind you
replacing it by the Volume of the Sacred Law about which you will arrange the three letters in the form
of a triangle; interlock the fingers of your hands and place the palms upon my forehead look into my
eyes and say after me;



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
I .. *end* in the Name of the Holy Trinity One and Indivisible and in the presence of this Perfect and Princely
Chapter of the Holy Order of the Rose Croix of Heredom do hereby and hereon most solemnly promise
and swear that I will hele conceal and never reveal the Mysteries of a Sovereign Prince Rose Croix *end*
I swear eternal fealty and allegiance to the Supreme Council by whose authority this Chapter is
constituted in the person of its Most Puissant Sovereign Grand Commander Baphomet *end*
I further pledge myself to the service of the Order to the last drop of my blood and the last penny of my
purse *end*
All this I swear to observe without evasion equivocation or mental reservation of any kind were it at
the cost of the death of my body and the damnation of my soul *end*
Aumn *end*
Arise newly-obligated brother raising to your lips the Volume of the Sacred Law and seal the Oath with
seven kisses *end*
Done *end*
Very Excellent and Perfect Grand Marshal let the Postulant be conducted from the Chapter and invested
with a black apron and collar for by such a badge we do designate those who are in search of the Lost
Word *end*
G.M *end* takes out Postulant and invests him removing his P.M *end* apron saying ‘This attire cannot be worn
in the Age of the Lost Word’ *end* Meanwhile the Princes rise from their attitudes of mourning and extinguish
the lights overthrow the pillars strew the floor with corpses skulls and bones light a pungent incense
and the hell-broth *end* As the Candidate re-enters in charge of the Grand Marshal a sack is thrown over his
head and he is thrust through the veil and beaten pricked and pushed by all as they cry litanies of Jesus
Joseph and Mary while he gropes his way *end* The M.W.S *end* and G.M *end* should however retire to Red Room *end*
Second Point

All present enter the Red Room and assume insignia and stalls *end* The Most Reverend and Perfect Prelate
advances from the Red Room *end* She takes Postulant by the hand *end* The sack is removed *end*
H.P *end* I come to conduct you from the depths of darkness and the valley of death *end*
Truth will direct you when you err

Silence will sustain you in every trial



The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
Love will comfort you upon your path *end*
Musick ‘Tristan and Isolde’ *end*
The door of the Red Room is opened by G.M *end* who removes the black apron and collar *end* The Postulant
finds himself at the foot of the ladder *end* G.M *end* closes door behind him *end* All present are in the Sign of
Heredom *end*
H.P *end* Holy Father I present to you this worthy Knight who has passed through the depths of darkness
and the Valley of Death in search of the Lost Word having been fortified with Truth Silence and Love *end*
M.W.S *end* Let the Postulant Ascend the ladder which leads to glory and perfection *end*
H.P *end* tells P *end* to take one step I° and pick up the letter *end*

P *end* Truth *end*

The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
 step *end*

Before you are again admitted to any Chapter you must have caused this mark to be tattooed over your
heart so that the scar which can never be effaced from your body may remind you of those oaths which
you have taken to us *end* They can never be effaced from your soul *end*

M.W.S *end* Rises *end* I will now communicate to you the signs and words of this degree *end*
The first sign is called the Sign of Adoration *end* Clasp &c raising etc *end* Then &c *end*
The second sign or Sign of Freedom *end* Close &c or as some say &c and place &c *end*
This may be replaced by the Grand Cross sign of Heredom or Devotion Clench &c *end*
The third sign is that of the G.S *end* or of P .. *end* Cross &c *end*
This sign is always used on entering or leaving a chapter and may be employed in greeting a brother *end*
Say A.F.O *end* He replies P.P.V *end*
The forth sign or Sign of Truth *end* Raise &c and say A *end* Point downwards and say D *end*
The fifth sign or Sign of Silence *end* Place &c and say I *end* The other &c P.V *end*
The sixth sign or Sign of Love *end* Clasp &c and say T *end* As you &c he says R *end*
The seventh sign or Sign of I.N.R.I *end* Form &c &c &c *end*
The Grip is given by &c *end*

.. *end* and in this place the meaning &c *end* The Royal Omnific Password is .. *end*

the West and proclaim him *end*

of Ancient and Accepted Masonry *end*
THE CLOSING OF A

SOVEREIGN CHAPTER OF ROSE CROIX

THE RED ROOM

M.W.S *end* Very Excellent and Perfect Princes assist me if it be your pleasure to close this .. *end* Chapter of
the Holy Order of Rose Croix of Heredom *end*
All rise *end*
Holy Mother what is the hour *end*
H.P *end* It is the hour when the Lost Word is found; when the Sacred Tau has bloomed into the Mystic
Rose; when the Star called Wormwood is cast into the Abyss and the Blazing Star has reappeared in all
its splendour; when our altars have been renewed and the Light restored to our eyes *end*
The New Covenant is established; Do What Thou Wilt is the whole of the Law *end*


The Secret Rituals of the O.T.O *end*
.. *end* and musick *end*
M.W.S *end* Let us then my excellent Companions observe this Law which will enable us to erect a
pyramid in our hearts to the glory of Him to whom belongeth Might Majesty Dominion and Power;
who liveth and reigneth world without end *end*
All make the  signs of Adoration Heredom and Pan *end*
M.W.S *end* Therefore with my heel upon the head of the Great Serpent He goes out and turns facing red
room *end* I declare this .. *end* Chapter of Rose Croix duly closed in the name of Babalon and The Beast
conjoined of the Secret Savior and of IAO *end*
